products.quality: Keyfiyyətli Materiallar: “Paslanmayan polad korpus və ilgək qolbaq, mavi siferblat. Saatı cızıqlardan qoruyan möhkəm mineral kristaldan hazırlanıb.
products.delivery: Watches.com Standard International Mail* (249$-dan yuxarı sifarişlər) və Standard Domestic Mail (100$+-dan yuxarı sifarişlər) xərclərini ödəyəcək. Bütün ölkələr pulsuz beynəlxalq göndərmə üçün uyğun deyil. Təkmilləşdirilmiş göndərmə seçimləri (təxmini tranzit vaxtları və tariflər) yoxlama zamanı təklif ediləcək.Watches.com 1999-cu ildən bütün dünyaya göndərilir və biz hər gün beynəlxalq miqyasda göndəririk. Sifarişlərin çoxu adi iş günlərində bazar ertəsindən cümə gününə qədər saat 17:00-a (MST) qədər emal edilir və göndərilir. Ödənişin/fırıldaqçılığın yoxlanılması adətən ani olur, lakin bəzi hallarda 48 saata qədər çəkə bilər. Saat 12:00-dan (MST) sonra verilən/qəbul edilən sifarişlər növbəti iş günü həyata keçiriləcək. Nəzərə alın ki, UPS həftə sonları çatdırmır. Gömrük rüsumları ölkədən asılı olaraq fərqli olduğundan, biz yoxlama zamanı rüsum almırıq. Əgər rüsumlar ödənilirsə, gömrük agentliyiniz paket ölkənizə çatdıqda sizə xəbər verəcəkdir. Bu ödənişləri ölkənizə ödəmək sizin məsuliyyətinizdir.Mallar göndərildikdən sonra məsuliyyət daşıyıcının şərtləri ilə əhatə olunur. Müştərinin göstərdiyi ünvana çatdırırıq. Əgər bizə dəqiq ünvan verməmisinizsə, nə Watches.com, nə də daşıyıcı məhsulun itirilməsinə görə məsuliyyət daşıya bilməz. Zəhmət olmasa göndərmə ünvanınızı iki dəfə yoxlayın. Göndərmə ilə bağlı hər hansı ziyan çatdırıldıqdan sonra 48 saat ərzində Watches.com-a bildirilməlidir, əks halda bu, hər hansı sığorta və ya pulun geri qaytarılması iddiası üçün uyğun deyil. Qeyd: Casio-nun siyasətinə görə, Casio və G-Shock saatları Beynəlxalq Göndərmə üçün uyğun deyil. Casio və ya G-Shock saatı olan istənilən beynəlxalq sifariş ləğv ediləcək və bütün pullar geri qaytarılacaq.

products.title: Fossil Men's Neutra Stainless Steel Mechanical Watch

blog.title: What is the cheapest men’s Rolex available?
blog.part_one: Nowadays, the brand of Rolex is far more than a simple watchmaker. No brand that calls the wrist home can elicit the same global acknowledgment of status and luxury lifestyle like a Rolex can. In some ways, it is almost odd that a trinket of such significance comes in more than one style or is priced at more than one point. Why? Well, the power of the “Rolex” name is really more relevant to the layman than what model of Rolex it is you might specifically be wearing. And so perhaps the most commonly asked question I come across when discussing Rolex with current and would-be collectors is, quite simply, “What is the cheapest men’s Rolex available?”
blog.part_two: And I cannot blame them for asking! At least the questioner in question is keen on a genuine Rolex rather than a fake. That counts for much more than just something, and so I take the question seriously and say, “there’s no simple answer, but let’s start with the dimensions…”
blog.part_three: For many brands, 36mm would be considered below (in many cases, way below) what one would consider a men’s watch, but, when it comes to Rolex, 36mm isn’t just the starting point for entry-level Rolex watches, but it is quite possibly the destination as well.
blog.part_four: You see, because Rolex is such an important brand, whose heritage is not just a flimsy purchasing justification you might try and palm off on your wife or husband or boyfriend or girlfriend, but an actual, tangible, culturally significant thing, a lot of its models have remained almost frozen in time. It is frequently said — especially by Alon Ben Joseph, my co-host on The Real Time Show — that Rolex is a brand of evolution, not revolution. The changes it makes to its offering can rarely be described as anything more dramatic than “subtle”. That is, if we’re being totally honest, to the brand’s credit. It is easy to be a little bit sour on the subject of Rolex because even its more affordable models are almost impossible to get, but there is a good reason for it. Rolex is the best at being whatever the heck Rolex is because nothing else is anything like it. The most affordable Rolex range is the Oyster Perpetual family. This family dates all the way back to 1926 when Rolex paid its ground-breaking water-resistant case (the Oyster) with its automatic (perpetual) movement. The collection has been a mainstay in the Rolex catalog ever since.
blog.part_five: In 2023, the Oyster Perpetual family comes in several sizes. It can be found in 28mm, 31mm, 34mm, 36mm, and 41mm. While I have personally owned 34mm Rolex watches in the past, those were very vintage. Although they looked alright on my slim (16.5cm) wrist, I would say it is broadly fair to discount anything other than the 36mm and 41mm as ladies’ watches.
blog.part_six: Unsurprisingly, the 36mm models are marginally cheaper than the 41mm pieces, with all models in the smaller size retailing for $6,100 while the larger models command $300 more each and come in at $6,400. In recent months, Rolex has reduced the number of dial options in these sizes, removing some of the more vibrant colors (like the coral red and sunflower yellow), leaving us with just a racing green, a black, a navy, and a silver sunburst to choose from in each and an additional light blue and baby pink available in the 36mm.
blog.part_seven: But while the MSRP of these models starts a shade over six grand, it is possible to find cheaper entry points on either the pre-owned market or via sellers that stock now discontinued models from the brand. Interestingly, there is actually a Rolex Oyster Perpetual 41 Automatic Silver Dial Men's Watch (one of Rolex’s most recent releases) available brand new before any of its 36mm brethren make an appearance on Jomashop.com. This perhaps speaks to the very “Rolex” phenomenon of “smaller” watches being more sought after. However, the resultant fact is thus: You’re able to snare a totally current Rolex in very desirable proportions for $8,100, a premium of just $1,700 over the list price.
blog.part_eight: And while paying over list for anything can be irksome, there is always the worrying possibility that models like this one might be discontinued before your turn on the waiting list comes up. It’s a gamble I’ve run myself on more than one occasion, only to come up red-faced and empty-handed, but whether or not to jump into that “over list world” is a very personal choice indeed, and not one I’ll be dishing out advice on (largely because my personal feelings shift about so much on the subject from day to day and, these days, hour to hour depending on what watch it is I’m currently lusting after).
blog.part_nine: The first new 36mm Rolex to appear on Jomashop.com currently, is actually the Rolex Oyster Perpetual Automatic Chronometer Blue Dial men’s watch, which comes in at an approachable $8,950 (anything under 10K these days has to be considered “half decent” when it comes to Rolex acquisition).
blog.part_ten: So that’s it! The cheapest men’s Rolex is (if you can buy one direct) $6,100 (rising to $6,400 if you prefer 41mm to 36), but if you want one right now, you either need to go preowned (not a bad idea in this climate) or stretch your budget the best part of two grand further to attain a 41 or 36mm watch from the modern collection. Happy hunting!

blog.title: Dress Watch Wars! Hamilton Vs. Longines Round Three
blog.part_one: For this installment of Dress Watch Wars, I’ve chosen two very easy-to-wear watches with stainless steel cases and gold hour markers. That’s really the extent of what unites them, but I think that’s enough given this unusual (although very lovable) aesthetic quirk means both watches can be worn with a variety of jewelry metals making them unexpectedly versatile evening wear options.
blog.part_two: For many years — and I’m honestly not sure why it’s been so many years — I have coveted the Longines Conquest models. I find their use of levels on the dial (deploying a domed, sun-ray dial alongside wedge-shaped applied hour markers and encased beneath a stout box “crystal”) absolutely stunning. Turning the watch over in hand doesn’t reveal a display case back as one might have expected at this price point, but rather a closed back decorated with an enameled medallion in the center.
blog.part_three: This is, to me, a quaint throwback to a past that saw no value in revealing the oftentimes unfinished workings of the mechanical watches of the 1940s–1960s upon which this line is based. I’ve loved it for years, and I think that this execution, with the champagne dial, the yellow gold markers and hands, and the quirky 12 o’clock date, is my favorite.
blog.part_four: On the other side of the ring, we have a very different Hamilton watch in contention, which doesn’t stoke the fires of passion within me in quite the same way. However, this Intra-matic model does a lot very well considering its accessible price (on Jomashop for $698, 25% below its $930 retail).
blog.part_five: It is sympathetically sized at 38mm wide and 9.8mm thick. The movement within it is an unmodified ETA 2892, which, while better than the bog-standard 2824, is not as impressive as the modified Hamilton H-10 caliber, which uses an ETA base but increases the power reserve to a gargantuan 80 hours. Here, the power reserve is 42 hours, which is, interestingly, still four hours longer than the 38 hours offered by the Longines caliber L633. So the Hamilton has that on the Longines. It is also marginally slimmer considering the Longines stands 10.5mm tall on the wrist. However, the Longines is, somewhat surprisingly, 40mm wide and so has a very similar visual impact on the wrist despite its slightly engorged proportions. Yes, the Hamilton would slide under a shirt cuff with marginally more ease but it wouldn’t appear much smaller when wearing a T-shirt, for example.
blog.part_six: The Longines Heritage Conquest is much more expensive (it is available on Jomashop at $1,699, which is 31% below its $2,450 MSRP), but, I would contend, the finishing is a noticeable level above and, despite the fact the Hamilton proudly displays its movement and the Longines hides its arguably inferior engine behind a closed case back, it is much more interesting than the alternative.
blog.part_seven: If I were trying to decide between these two, I would stick to my guns and take the Longines, despite it being much more expensive, larger, and lacking the same power reserve. I guess all it took to sway me was the beautiful dial design that, despite so many thousands of watches on the market, looks like practically nothing else I’ve ever seen. But which one would you choose? Get in touch and let us know your choice and why you chose it!

blog.title: The Difference Between Quartz, Automatic, and Manual Wound Watches
blog.part_one: Watches are available in a variety of different types, each with their own unique features and advantages. Three of the most common types of watches are automatic, quartz, and manual wound watches.
blog.part_two: An automatic watch is powered by a self-winding mechanism, which is activated by the movement of the wearer's wrist. The movement of the wrist causes a rotor to spin, which in turn winds the mainspring. The mainspring stores energy, which is used to power the watch's various functions. Automatic watches are often considered to be the most traditional and elegant type of watch, and they are popular among collectors and enthusiasts.
blog.part_three: A quartz watch, on the other hand, uses a battery-powered quartz crystal to keep time. The quartz crystal oscillates at a very precise frequency, which is used to drive the watch's movement. Quartz watches are known for their accuracy and reliability. They are also relatively inexpensive and easy to maintain compared to automatic watches.
blog.part_four: A manual wound watch, also known as a hand-wound watch, is powered by a mainspring that needs to be wound by hand. Unlike an automatic watch, a manual wound watch does not have a self-winding mechanism, so the wearer must manually wind the watch on a regular basis to ensure that it keeps running. Manual wound watches are considered to be the most traditional type of watch and are often seen as a status symbol, as they require more attention and care from the wearer.
blog.part_five: In summary, the main difference between an automatic watch, a quartz watch, and a manual wound watch is the way they are powered. Automatic watches are powered by the movement of the wearer's wrist, quartz watches are powered by a battery-powered quartz crystal, and manual wound watches are powered by a mainspring that needs to be wound by hand. Each type of watch has its own unique features and advantages, and the best choice will depend on the individual's preferences and needs.

blog.title: How To: Assessing The Value of a Watch
blog.part_one: When assessing the value of a watch, there are several factors to consider, including the brand, model, materials, age, condition, and rarity. What makes a watch a good investment? For example, a vintage Patek Philippe watch in excellent condition would likely be worth significantly more than a brand-new, lower-end Timex watch. The condition of the watch is another important factor. A watch that is in excellent condition with all original parts and minimal wear and tear will be worth more than one that is heavily used or has been poorly maintained. Additionally, watches that are in “mint” condition or have never been worn can command a higher price than those that have been used.
blog.part_two: The best way to assess the value of a specific watch is to have it appraised by a professional. They will be able to examine the watch in person and take into account all relevant factors to give you a detailed and accurate estimate of its value.

part_ol.title: Brand: A watch's brand can significantly impact its value. Luxury brands such as Rolex, Patek Philippe, and Audemars Piguet are highly sought after and can command high prices.

Age: Vintage watches are often highly valued, particularly those from the mid-20th century. However, older watches may be less valuable if they are in poor condition or have been altered from their original state.

Condition: The condition of a watch is crucial in determining its value. A watch that is in good working condition and has all of its original parts will be more valuable than one that is in poor condition or has been repaired or altered.
Rarity: A watch that is rare and limited in production can be highly valued by collectors.
Papers and box: The original papers and box in which a watch was sold can also increase its value.
Demand: Market demand also plays an important role in valuing a watch. Watches that are in high demand can sell for higher prices.

blog.part_three: When assessing the value of a watch, it's a good idea to do your research and consult with experts in the field. The materials used to make the watch also play a role in determining its value. Watches made with precious metals like gold and platinum, as well as those with diamond or other precious stone embellishments, will generally be worth more than those made with stainless steel or other less expensive materials.
blog.part_four: Certain models within a brand can be more highly sought-after than others, driving up their value. Vintage watches, particularly those that are over 50 years old, can be highly valuable, especially if they are in good condition. Conversely, newer watches may not hold their value as well over time. When assessing the value of a watch, it is important to consider all of these factors. While brand and model are certainly important, other factors such as materials, age, condition, and rarity can also greatly impact a watch's value. For an accurate and detailed assessment, it is best to have the watch appraised by a professional.
blog.part_five: In the end, a watch's value is determined by a combination of factors such as its brand, age, condition, rarity, papers and box, and market demand. By taking the time to carefully evaluate each of these factors, you can better understand a watch's value and make an informed decision on whether to buy or sell.

blog.title: Everything You Need to Know: Buying a Timepiece
blog.part_one: When it comes to picking a watch, there are a few things to consider to ensure that you end up with a timepiece that suits your needs and style.
blog.part_two: First, consider the purpose of the watch. Are you looking for a watch to wear to formal events, or do you need something durable for outdoor activities? Different watches are designed for different purposes, so it's important to choose one that meets your specific needs.
blog.part_three: Next, think about the style of the watch. Do you want a classic, timeless look, or are you looking for something more modern and trendy? Watches come in a wide variety of styles, so it's important to choose one that aligns with your personal sense of style.
blog.part_four: Another important factor to consider is the features of the watch. Do you need a watch with a stopwatch function, or do you prefer one with a simple, easy-to-read dial? Do you need a watch with a date display, or are you happy with just the time?
blog.part_five: Also, consider the material of the watch. Watches can be made of a variety of materials, including stainless steel, leather, and even gold. Consider which material would be most comfortable for you to wear and which one will best match with your outfit or lifestyle.
blog.part_six: Finally, consider the brand and price of the watch. You may want to choose a well-known brand, or go for a more budget-friendly option. There are plenty of good quality watches available at different price points, so it's important to choose one that fits your budget.
blog.part_seven: In summary, when picking a watch, consider the purpose, style, features, material, brand and price to ensure that you end up with a timepiece that you'll love wearing for years to come.

blog.title: 10 High-End Watches for Women With Fine Taste
blog.part_one: As you read this article, some of you may be wondering, “What’s the big deal with luxury watches?” Breathe in! We will explain what all the fuss is about. Timepieces empower us with a means of self-expression. Why would someone wear a watch if they did not care about time? There you have it. The first impression matters. A lot! Even if you don’t know much about timepieces, just seeing someone wearing a high-end watch conveys an image of reliability and attention to detail. Brand nerds, on the other hand, can’t help but take note of the specific piece you’re sporting, recognizing the value of the label and the consideration that went into the selection of that watch. Thus, wearing a luxury watch does more than just tell time; it shows you appreciate meticulously produced items. A woman who wears a Rolex timepiece is likely to be a perfectionist who enjoys style icons. This implies that she is not easily swayed by short-lived trends and would rather buy a classic piece that will stand the test of time.
blog.part_two: Did you know that the first wristwatches were worn by women? The Hungarian Countess Koscowicz commissioned Patek Philippe to make a piece of jewelry that doubled as a watch in 1868, ushering in a new era of glitzy multipurpose timepieces. Not until the early 1900s did men begin to replace their pocket items with wristwatches. Certainly, women have been fans of luxury watches for centuries, but it seems that only recently have we become less reserved about sharing our passion. Lockdown, or a life on hold combined with a distinct sense of ennui, prompted us to rediscover old interests through social media. Gone are the days when a woman’s watch was supposed to be delicate and almost jewelry-like, and when ladies seeking a practical or technically advanced timepiece had to look to the top men’s watches to meet their utilitarian and aesthetic demands.
blog.part_three: The facile “let’s just take a man’s timepiece and make it smaller, pink, and with diamonds” that many watch brands have relied on historically for women’s items has worn thin. We need more! We expect more! Fortunately, there are notable brands that have been making watches with women in mind. Is there a reason it took so long for Haute Horlogerie to evolve? Well, think about this: these brands have existed for nearly 200 years. Given the luxury sector’s penchant for slow adaptation, when making something timeless, any changes that are implemented will have to remain for the long term. However, the industry is starting to listen. Lately, the finest luxury watch manufacturers (think Cartier, Patek Philippe, Rolex, and Vacheron Constantin) offer a wide range of women’s timepieces that are both exquisitely crafted and extremely stylish. This means that women are now taking an active role in the once-men-exclusive hobby of collecting deluxe watches.
blog.part_four: In the field of Haute Horlogerie, fine watchmakers are held in the same regard as artists. To put it simply, their work is as exquisite as that of any other high-end jewelry label. Their creations are worth thousands, if not millions, of dollars due to their refined engineering and panache. The Rolex Pearlmaster 34 is the quintessence of that. Whether displayed on a pedestal or worn on the wrist, its design will mesmerize anyone who sees it. This model is a limited-edition timepiece that combines the best elements of two of the top ladies’ collections from the Swiss manufacturer: the Datejust and the Pearlmaster. It is also worth noting that this watch has been officially certified as a Swiss chronometer, ensuring that its inner mechanisms and durability are as exemplary as its appearance. Well, one thing is certain: the Rolex Pearlmaster 34 Goldust Dream Roman Diamonds doesn’t just tell time; it tells history.
blog.part_five: Ever since the Patek Philippe Twenty-4 was released in 1999, we’ve been particularly fond of the timepiece. It has been enticing to see this unique women’s collection develop gracefully over the years while remaining the go-to watch for confident, career-driven women. And with the release of three new variants, one powered by quartz and two by mechanical movements, the classic Twenty 4 is keeping its innovative character alive. The inspiration behind this watch came from the desire to provide ladies with a “beautiful expression of today’s contemporary woman” that they may wear all the time. To meet this challenge, Patek Philippe returned to its roots without sacrificing creativity and conceived the Twenty 4 as a nod to the Art Deco era’s favored manchette bracelets. Some may also see this watch as a stylized Gondolo, and they would not be entirely off base in doing so. However, whereas the Gondolo is more classic in appearance, the Twenty-4 is thoroughly cutting-edge. By deftly blending different-sized and shaped rectangles, the brand achieved the ideal compromise between a piece of jewelry and a timepiece, giving this beauty a distinctive appearance while still being comfortable to wear.
blog.part_six: For today’s woman, a watch is both a statement accessory and a functional item. Eternity, modern design, outstanding craftsmanship, and understated elegance make ultrafeminine watches desirable and appropriate for both t-shirts and satin slip dresses. Meet the Omega Constellation! The timeless design by Carol Didisheim revolutionized unisex timepieces since they could have been worn with equal ease by both sexes. However, there is now an updated version of the classic Omega Constellation Manhattan dedicated only to ladies. After all, the Constellation has a rich heritage that began in the early 1950s and featured some of the most cherished dress watch designs ever produced by Omega. Thus, the new collection represents two sides of the same coin, and with the brand’s indisputable legacy, we figured it would be prudent to give it a fair shot with some wrist time.
blog.part_seven: The Cartier Panthere watch, a fashion staple since the 1980s, is making a comeback after an extended absence. You know, fashion and trends are like the tides; they come and go. Watches are no exception. Released in the heyday of extravagance and lauded for its minimalist design, hidden clasp, and link bracelet, the Panthere gained instant fame among the elite, including Madonna, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Jane Fonda. It’s no wonder that this watch was well-liked at a time when glamour ruled the night and Studio 54 was at its peak. But what does this have to do with the Panthere? Well, what we find most interesting about it is that, even though it’s just a women’s watch, it was a big deal for Cartier at a time when watches were getting cheaper and must have been a freedom fighter for a heritage mansion trying to restore its foothold in the global market. The new Panthere is spectacular while remaining understated and functional, and it does so effortlessly, which is also the key to its widespread popularity. To us, the best part about this high-end timepiece is that it has a classic look that works for everybody, from a conservative Ivy Leaguer to a trendy Voguette.
blog.part_eight: Launching an entirely new watch series, not just some slight modifications to an existing line, is a high-stakes gamble with major financial consequences, including the expense of design as well as the potential loss of both brand image and profits in the event of a flop. That’s why it’s a rare scenario. The introduction of a brand-new women’s watch collection is even more unusual. But when Vacheron Constantin released the Egerie line in 2020 as a striking homage to women, we understood that everything is possible. First of all, we appreciate Vacheron’s strength of character for not going with a completely safe and easy name. Its roots aren’t obvious unless you know a thing or two about mythology, but Egerie comes from Egeria, an ancient Roman nymph, and means “muse” or “inspiration.” Rich, sumptuous, full, robust, energetic, and mesmerizing are the first words that come to mind when you first see this watch.Even though it is an unquestionably feminine piece, it has nothing girly about it. Creamy-white dials with a lot of texture and detail, as well as an asymmetric layout, lift its design well above the conventional timepiece.
blog.part_nine: Our galaxy, also known as the Milky Way, is a vast and truly remarkable assortment of stars, dust, planets, and matter. So, it makes sense that Breitling named this watch “Galactic”, given that it encompasses the brand’s universe by combining its finest qualities. An ultra-sporty appearance mixed with elegance, an edge of toughness, and some delicate touches culminate in a wristwatch that is suitable for any occasion. Thus, this piece was obviously made for the kind of woman who can go from hiking in the Alps during the day to a gala dinner in Monaco at night. With this beauty, you may proudly show off the unabashed statement of Breitling’s identity as a watchmaker that guarantees a rich legacy. In contrast to other women’s timepieces, the Breitling Galactic features a rough refinement coated in elegant class for those ladies who don’t mind getting their hands dirty and wrists gracious.
blog.part_ten: These timepieces are more than just high-quality items; they are also works of art, designed to be worn and admired for decades. Therefore, this curated list will assist you in selecting a timepiece that is both fashionable and durable, whether you’re gifting it or buying one for yourself. Ranging from sporty and sturdy to elegant and sophisticated, each of these high-end watches has its own unique features and strong personality.
